most_active_tickets.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?

common_issues.title: Pieces OS crashes due to native_extensions_plugin.dll
common_issues.description: Pieces OS desktop application crashes on Windows due to the native_extensions_plugin.dll.  Reinstalling, disabling antivirus/firewall, and updating graphics drivers do not resolve the issue. Users are looking for a way to disable the plugin to prevent crashes. Debug logs point to the native_extensions_plugin as the source of the crash.

related_issues.title: Crash due to native_extensions_plugin.dll
related_issues.text:
Crash due to native_extensions_plugin.dll
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS crashes. I’ve reinstalled the program, turned off the antivirus and firewall, updated the graphics driver, but nothing helps, it crashes consistently.
Windows 10, 64 bit, i3-12100F, RAM: 32 Gb, GTX 950.
If there's no solution, how can I disable this plugin so that it simply doesn't crash?

Here are the debug details:
```

rcx=0000000000000000
```

I would appreciate any help :3

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Conversation Summary: Account Linking Issues in Pieces App

**Key points raised:**

* **Johnkennyuk:** Unable to link Github account to main account (Google with custom domain). 
* **Johnkennyuk:** Prefers to keep Google account as the main account.
* **Johnkennyuk:** Willing to wait for the new authentication system to be released.
* **Johnkennyuk:** Successfully linked accounts with the new authentication system, but in the wrong order.
* **Kanjibrian**: Encountered an authentication error (ID: 00000000000000000000000000000000) while trying to link an account.

**Problems Identified:**

* The old authentication system had issues with case-sensitive email addresses, leading to linking problems.
* Johnkennyuk accidentally linked his accounts in the wrong order with the new system.
* Kanjibrian encountered a general authentication error with no specific details.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Mark-at-pieces:** Resetting Johnkennyuk's Github account to try the linking process again.
* **Mark-at-pieces:** Manually merging Johnkennyuk's accounts.
* **Mark-at-pieces:** Providing a link to their calendar for a support call.
* **Mark-at-pieces**: Requesting logs from Kanjibrian to troubleshoot the authentication error.
 
**Current status/outcome:**

* Johnkennyuk's issue is resolved, but they'll need to relink their accounts in the correct order.
* Kanjibrian's issue requires further investigation with logs.

**Additional notes:**

* The new authentication system is expected to be released in early/mid-March.
* The old authentication system will be replaced by the end of the month.

I hope this summary provides a clear overview of the conversation and its outcome.

recommendations: Investigate and fix the crash caused by native_extensions_plugin.dll on Windows.
Improve account linking functionality to allow users to connect multiple accounts simultaneously.
Provide clearer documentation or in-app guidance for account linking.
Investigate and resolve the authentication error encountered by some users (ID: 00000000000000000000000000000000).
